findings.reasoning: The finding identifies a genuine logic error in the epoch-tracking mechanism. In the `vote` function, `lastVoted` is set to `HybraTimeLibrary.epochStart(block.timestamp) + 1`. In the next epoch, `HybraTimeLibrary.epochStart(block.timestamp)` will equal the value stored in `lastVoted`. The modifier `onlyNewEpoch` checks `if (HybraTimeLibrary.epochStart(block.timestamp) <= lastVoted[_tokenId]) revert("VOTED");`. Because of the `<=` operator and the `+ 1` offset, a user who votes in Epoch N will be blocked from voting in Epoch N+1, effectively forcing a one-epoch cooldown between voting epochs, which is likely unintended in a ve(3,3) system where users should be able to update votes every epoch.

notes: The model completely missed the target vulnerability regarding the DoS in the `poke()` function caused by rounding to zero with dust weights. Instead, it found a valid logic error in the epoch-checking logic that restricts voting frequency more than intended.
